most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.3.0 Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0, including infinite loading during login and database corruption preventing startup.  Workarounds involve logging in through the Pieces toolbar and avoiding refreshing the login page. The Pieces team is actively investigating and fixing these issues.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are unable to link their Google accounts after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0.
* Login attempts via https://authentication.pieces.services/ result in infinite loading.
* The issue occurs on Windows 11, both through Pieces desktop app and the PiecesOS toolbar.

**Problems Identified:**

* A bug in the authentication flow prevents the callback to the local PiecesOS instance, causing login attempts to hang.
* Manually refreshing the login page exacerbates the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Users are advised to login from the Pieces toolbar and avoid manual refresh of the login page.
* The Pieces team is investigating and fixing the authentication pipeline issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The bug has been identified and is being fixed by the Pieces team.
* An updated version with the fix is expected to be released soon.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users with further issues can schedule a support call with @mark-at-pieces.
* @freccon's screen recordings and support logs significantly aided in troubleshooting the issue.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Antoine79, a new user, is experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop launching.
* The support bot identified the issue as a database bootup problem.
* Mark (support representative) suggested a real-time debug session to diagnose the problem.
* Antoine is willing to delete the entire database, but needs help locating it.

**Problems identified:**

* Database bootup failure for a new user.
* Unclear cause for the error.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Real-time debug session with a support representative.
* Mark provided Antoine with instructions on locating the database for deletion.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The status of the issue is unclear, as there are no further updates after Antoine's last comment.
* The potential fix identified by Mark has not been implemented or confirmed.

**Additional Information:**

* This issue is similar to previously reported issues related to Pieces Desktop launching.
* Several resources are available for users to explore, including existing issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel.

recommendations: Investigate and fix the authentication pipeline issue causing infinite loading on login after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0 (https://authentication.pieces.services/).
Investigate and fix the database corruption issue preventing Pieces OS 11.3.0 from starting up.
Provide clear instructions and documentation on how to locate and delete the Pieces OS database for troubleshooting purposes.
Consider implementing a database recovery or repair mechanism to address corruption issues without requiring complete deletion.
Monitor and address any potential performance issues related to database operations, especially during startup and login.
